II. Purpose of Addendum
The Life Preparation Center program at Crossroads for Youth is moving into a newly
renovated building on campus.
III. Methodology
Fire
10/21/2010
Department of Energy, Labor & Economic Growth inspection resulted in non-
compliances.
11/03/2010
Department of Energy, Labor & Economic Growth gave final approval. The non-
compliances from the 10/21/2010 were corrected.
11/09/2010
Qualified Fire Inspection report recommended an A-rating. The facility was
determined to be in substantial compliance.
Environmental
11/05/2010
Oakland County Health Division – Food Service Establishment gave approval.
11/16/2010
Environmental Health Inspection report recommended an A-rating. The facility was
determined to be in substantial compliance.
Certificate of Occupancy
11/09/2010
The facility met all the applicable codes of the Charter Township of Oxford.
Tour
10/21/2010 and 11/15/2010
This consultant toured the renovated building.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The newly renovated 3444 square foot Life Preparation Center (LPC) building is a
“green” building funded by an energy grant. The rectangular building includes
environmentally efficient items, such as, spray foam, sheeting doors, sun tubes and
efficient heating and cooling systems. The front door leads to the foyer area and to
an open dining room and kitchen area. There is a community room with large
windows for line of sight located next to the dining room. The staff office has large
windows and is located across from the community room. The resident’s sleeping
2

quarters, study tables and bathroom facilities are located in the back of the building.
The building also has a laundry room and a social service worker office.
The current LPC program will move into this renovated building. This LPC program
will have a maximum capacity of 20 male residents. The Achievement Center
program will move into the former LPC building once it is vacated. The Achievement
Center program will have a maximum capacity of 40 male residents.
V. Recommendation
It is approved for the Life Preparation Center program to move into the renovated
building.
